item.title: 17 Epic Man Cave Design Ideas
item.dc:creator: editor
item.content:encoded:
[caption id="attachment_21" align="alignnone" width="800"] Photo via Laura U. Inc.[/caption] Stop me if you've heard (or said) this before, "..Maybe we can hang that neon light in the garage instead of the living room?" If you and your significant other can't seem to agree on decor, then maybe it's time to dedicate a room in your home for a man cave. So, what exactly is a man cave? It's a space within a house (or garage) where a grown man can display and enjoy all of his favorite stuff. Things like head mounts, dart boards and sports memorabilia are commonly found here. More importantly, it's a room where a man's wife doesn't have to look at this stuff everyday. You could say it's the key to every successful marriage. Since we are big fans of happy and healthy marriages, we've assembled 17 man cave ideas that will make both husbands and wives happy. In this gallery you'll find design ideas for sports fans, outdoorsmen, car lovers and handymen. Below each photo we include tips on how to incorporate these ideas into your own home as well as product suggestions.

For Sports Fans

[caption id="attachment_10" align="alignnone" width="800"] Photo via Sights and Sounds[/caption] Although it would be awesome to have multiple TV's mounted in the living room, it probably won't fly with your significant other. So, why not install a few big screens in your man cave? This room has 5 TV's so you can watch all the big games at once. The dark furniture and built-ins are a great contrast to the white jerseys and memorabilia mounted on the walls. [caption id="attachment_12" align="alignnone" width="800"] Photo via J Hettinger Interiors[/caption] Some men are forced to watch sports in the basement, but this is a great example of what you can do in an attic. They've enclosed the space above the TV to improve the acoustics and painted the accent wall a dark blue to make the space look larger. This room also features accent lighting above the couch and dark wood wainscoting around the room. [caption id="attachment_13" align="alignnone" width="800"] Photo via La Casa Builders[/caption] Not only is this a great place to watch sports but also grab a drink with your buddies. In the center of the room is a large bar with 4 bar stools. Behind the bar is shelving to display bottles as well as a flat screen TV. There are two leather arm chairs at one end of the room next to a pool table and a large sectional couch at the other end. [caption id="attachment_19" align="alignnone" width="800"] Photo via Bobbi Bulmer[/caption] Don't like golfing in the rain or waiting behind a slow 4-some? Why not stay at home and play a round of golf. This man cave features a golf simulator and a full size pool table. The stacked stone wall and dark wood furniture gives this space a warm and comfortable setting to relax and hang out. [caption id="attachment_20" align="alignnone" width="800"] Photo via Schilling and Company[/caption] If you love baseball, you'll love this room. Along the walls are baseball jerseys, bats and balls displayed in dark wood cases. Like other rooms in this gallery, this room has dark colored walls which help contrast the items on the wall.

For Outdoorsmen

[caption id="attachment_22" align="alignnone" width="800"] Photo via Murphy and Co Design[/caption] For some guys a room just isn't big enough for all their stuff. If this is the case, then a garage is also the perfect male sanctuary. Whether you like to hunt, fish or work on cars, there's plenty of room in this hunting barn. [caption id="attachment_23" align="alignnone" width="800"] Photo via Kokopelli Builders[/caption] Wish you could display your guns instead of hiding them in the safe? Why not decorate the walls of your private oasis with your favorite guns? This room has special accent lighting installed to showcase the objects along the wall for closer inspection. Also, the rustic wood shelving is a great contrast to the white tufted furniture. [caption id="attachment_17" align="alignnone" width="800"] Photo via Adrienne Nienkamp[/caption] If there's not enough space in your home for a man cave, a man closet just might have to do. This hunting closet is a great place to organize and display your favorite gear. The shelves and drawers are perfect for storing items that you use every weekend. Never lose your gear again. [caption id="attachment_18" align="alignnone" width="800"] Photo via Vining Design Associates[/caption] We had to include this hunting lodge as part of our collection of man caves. Although everyone doesn't have this much extra space in their homes, it is something to work towards. Not only does this room have a bar, pool table and shuffleboard but it also features a moose antler chandelier.

For Car Lovers

[caption id="attachment_11" align="alignnone" width="800"] Photo via Bagnato Architects[/caption] This modern take on the man cave has an amazing view of the garage through large glass windows. Inside the room is a full bar with floor to ceiling wine storage as well as a pool table. [caption id="attachment_24" align="alignnone" width="800"] Photo via Robinette Architects[/caption] Wish you could hang out with your cars all day? Take a few tips from this custom garage and add a table and chairs to relax. Although this was originally an ordinary garage, it now has upgraded flooring, accent lights and automotive memorabilia throughout the room. Just imagine the possibilities. [caption id="attachment_25" align="alignnone" width="800"] Photo via Cooper Johnson Smith Architects[/caption]

For Handymen

[caption id="attachment_26" align="alignnone" width="800"] Photo via Authentic Custom Homes[/caption] [caption id="attachment_27" align="alignnone" width="800"] Photo via Swift Companies[/caption]

For Everyone Else

[caption id="attachment_15" align="alignnone" width="800"] Photo via Benedict August[/caption] [caption id="attachment_16" align="alignnone" width="800"] Photo via Michael Abrams Interiors[/caption] [caption id="attachment_14" align="alignnone" width="800"] Photo via Cord Shiflet[/caption]

Conclusion

During our research we found hundreds of design ideas but we had to narrow it down to the 17 best man caves. Let me tell you that this was no easy task. What we discovered was that the most impressive rooms were the ones that selectively displayed memorabilia. While it can be tempting to hang every poster or fill every cabinet with souvenirs, our best advice is to choose carefully. If you have too many objects you want to fit in a small space, you can always rotate memorabilia throughout the year or as the seasons change. When you are decorating a man cave, don't forget to paint the walls and add accent lighting to highlight important items. Other than that, enjoy the process and make it your own.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: 17 Epic Man Cave Design Ideas - Doorways Magazine
Looking for man cave ideas? See our photo gallery of 17 designs you can use in your home, garage or basement. Plus ideas for sports fans and outdoors men.

item.title: Cedarwood Essential Oils: A Complete Guide
item.dc:creator: editor
item.content:encoded:
Unlike other essential oils, Cedarwood essential oil is not made from flowers and leaves. Instead, it is made from wood and root of different coniferous trees. The scientific nomenclature of these trees is Juniperus Virgiana. Cedarwood oil is used in diverse fields like art, aromatherapy, perfume industry, industrial factories and medicine.

30 ml 10 ml 15 ml 15 ml
[easyazon_link identifier="B000MGWIMK" locale="US" tag="doorways-20"]See Price[/easyazon_link] [easyazon_link identifier="B002RU3RWY" locale="US" tag="doorways-20"]See Price[/easyazon_link] [easyazon_link identifier="B00VQ17A6O" locale="US" tag="doorways-20"]See Price[/easyazon_link] [easyazon_link identifier="B00GUSF31M" locale="US" tag="doorways-20"]See Price[/easyazon_link]

Benefits of Cedarwood Oil

1. Cures cough and phlegm problems: Cedarwood oil is an efficient expectorant. It removes congested phlegm in our respiration system, thereby curing the cough and cold. Use it for quick relief from the seasonal cold and cough problems. 2. Prevents and cures fungal infection: Cedarwood oil is a natural fungicide. It prevents and even cures fungal infections. It can be used externally and internally to cure infections, prevent food poisoning, etc. 3. Reduces and prevents inflammation: Due to its anti-inflammatory properties, Cedarwood oil is very beneficial for people who suffer from pain and inflammation of joints. It lessens the swelling in joints and reduces the pain and distress. 4. Relieve Spasms: Cedarwood oil is known for its antispasmodic properties. Its soothing aroma and medicinal properties help relieve almost all types of spasms. Whether it is asthma or restless leg syndrome, spasms in muscles or seizures, Cedar wood oil can provide relief. 5. Anti-septic: You can apply Cedarwood Oil on wounds as an antiseptic. It will prevent the wound from getting infected. 6. Aromatherapy: Its clean earthy smell soothes and calms our mind and relaxes our body. It is used extensively in Aromatherapy for relaxation purposes. It helps alleviate stress, anxiety and tension. It is also used to improve sleep quality and helps people get peaceful and uninterrupted sleep. 7. Diuretic: Due to its diuretic properties, consumption of Cedarwood oil leads to a rise in urination frequency. As a result, all the toxins, extra water and other wastes are removed consistently from the body. This improves kidney functions, gets rid of extra water in our body, treats the urinary tract infection and helps in other diseases like arthritis and gout.

Common Cedarwood Oil Uses

Here are a few of the most popular uses for Cedarwood essential oils:
  • Antiseptic, astringent and fungicide
  • Relax and sooth our stressed out body and mind
  • Treat UTIs, kidney problems, respiratory problems and relieves spasms
Cedarwood oil should not be applied in high concentration as it may cause skin irritations. Also, it should not be used by pregnant or breast feeding ladies. Last, but not least, it should never be ingested as it causes damage to the digestive system.

Origin

The Cedarwood tree is native to North America but other trees in the Juniperus Virgiana family are also found in areas which have cold climate and located at high altitudes. In ancient times, Cedarwood oil was used by Sumerians, Egyptians, Native Americans and Tibetans. Native Americans burned its wood for its purifying properties. Egyptians used it in making mummies and insect repellants. Interestingly enough, it is made through the process of Steam Distillation.

Where to Buy

You can purchase it from Amazon or you can buy it from local drugstores.

item.title: Shower Extension Arms: The Best We Tested

[caption id="attachment_4995" align="alignright" width="300"] Photo via Studio G+S Architects[/caption]One of the things that most people do not want to have to do the first thing in the morning is to fight the position of their showerhead before they are even fully awake. When it comes to taking a shower in comfort, the position of the showerhead is a key element. If the showerhead is too high or too low, users have to bend in awkward positions or feel like they have to run around the tub just in order to get clean. If either of these scenarios happens to be the case with your showering experience, a shower extension arm could be the cure to those early morning blues.

The Easy Way to Adjust Your Showerhead Height

Unless you happen to have a showering spot that is custom-made to fit your personal needs and those of each person that uses it, most showering areas include a showerhead placement height that is between 72 to 84-inches from the floor of the shower or tub. Although this may be an industry standard in many locations, these heights do not work out well for a lot of people, especially tall men. You are able to rectify this problem by adding a showerhead with an extension arm in place of your current equipment. Showerhead arms are usually adjustable and come in a variety of lengths to choose from, with some of the most popular sizes being arms that range between 9 to 15-inches in length. Extension arms also are available in a variety of fashionable finish choices that include polished chrome, stainless steel, and oil-brushed bronze.

Top Shower Arm Reviews

If you are thinking about adding a showerhead extension arm to your bath but do not know what to look for, here are a few choices that can help get you pointed in the right direction:

[easyazon_link asin="B0064TYE9Y" locale="US" tag="neighborhoodenvy-20"]Delta Faucet UA902-PK Adjustable Shower Arm[/easyazon_link]

[easyazon_link asin="B0064TYE9Y" locale="US" tag="neighborhoodenvy-20"][/easyazon_link]This particular model has a universal fit and an attractive chrome finish. The 10-inch adjustable shower arm is built to last, is easy to install, and is made to work at any angle. With over 500 reviews on Amazon and an overall rating of 4.3 stars, you'll be in the company of many other satisfied customers after installing this extension in your shower.

[easyazon_link asin="B000PUHVMU" locale="US" tag="neighborhoodenvy-20"]Thunderhead TH2.5 High Pressure Rain Showerhead[/easyazon_link]

[easyazon_link asin="B000PUHVMU" locale="US" tag="neighborhoodenvy-20"][/easyazon_link]If you are looking to add an extension arm and also replace your existing showerhead, this model may be just the ticket. Not only does this unit come with a large spray nozzle that includes 90 spray jets, it also includes the patented Acrobat Extension Arm that gives you the ability to lock the showerhead into a variety of positions and angles.

[easyazon_link asin="B00Q7HDMKK" locale="US" tag="neighborhoodenvy-20"]Aquagenix Razor 15-inch Extension Arm[/easyazon_link]

[easyazon_link asin="B00Q7HDMKK" locale="US" tag="neighborhoodenvy-20"][/easyazon_link]This showerhead extension arm features an attractive stainless steel profile and arched design which is ideal for those who have rainfall showerheads or who want extreme mobility. Made to handle extra heavy weight, this model is one of the longest on the market. Whether you are very tall or just want to get your showerhead further away from the wall, a long extension just might do the trick.

[easyazon_link asin="B0012QM28Y" locale="US" tag="neighborhoodenvy-20"]Danze D481150 9-inch Adjustable Shower Arm with High Flow[/easyazon_link]

[easyazon_link asin="B0012QM28Y" locale="US" tag="neighborhoodenvy-20"][/easyazon_link]This showerhead extension arm features a solid brass construction with an attractive chrome finish. It is made to easily fit over an existing shower arm and offers multiple adjustment settings to give you the best height and angle. Sometimes all a person needs to take their showering experience to the next level of greatness is just a simple tweak that can come from adding a shower extension arm. There are a many attractive and affordable options on the market that are easy to install, so say good-bye to your old shower routine and hello to brighter mornings.

item.title: Butcher Block Countertops: A Buyer's Guide
item.dc:creator: editor
item.content:encoded:
Looking for a natural and warm countertop material? Butcher Block countertops may be perfect for your kitchen. Although butcher block countertops are not recommended for your entire kitchen, they are a great compliment to other materials. For example, butcher blocks are perfect for kitchen islands, workspaces or even bars. The reason you should avoid using them throughout your kitchen is because they are sensitive to heat, moisture and scratching. It is recommended that you not install butcher block countertops next to your sink or stove. Water and heat are the primary enemies of butcher block countertops.

Maintenance

Unlike other countertop materials like granite and marble, butcher block countertops should not be sealed. Instead, they must be finished with oil. Ideally, wood countertops must be oiled every six months. Why not sealed? Sealed wood is generally not safe for food preparation. Instead, you will find sealed wood on bar surfaces or furniture where raw food is absent. Wood countertops are not heat resistant, so be careful with hot pans or plates. Put down a hot pad to keep your countertops looking great. Don't forget that wood countertops are just like any other wood furniture - they will develop water spots and scratches if not handled with care.

Available Colors

The most popular style of butcher block countertops you'll find in kitchens have an edge grain. They are built with long strips of wood glued together with their edges facing upward. Other styles include flat grain and end grain countertops. When shopping for countertops you're likely to find Maple, Cherry and Walnut are the most common. However, Bamboo is becoming more popular among those looking for a sustainable alternative. Maple is preferred because it is a hard wood and very durable. It also has a light finish and subtle grain patterns which make it very complimentary to a wide range of kitchen styles.

item.title: White Tea
item.dc:creator: editor
item.content:encoded:
Black, green, and white tea all come from the same plant. While black and green tea are very healthy for you, white tea is the least processed and has the highest nutrient and antioxidant levels. It also has the most potent anti-cancer properties than other processes teas.

Benefits

White tea has the wonderful quality of lowering blood pressure, reducing cholesterol, and thinning you blood. These benefits work together to protect your heart. In fact, scientists have noticed that those who drink 2 or more cups of white tea a day are 50% more likely to survive a heart attack. This is an impressive statistic! The antioxidants in white tea have long been noticed to have a positive fighting effect against cancer causing cells. For example, flavonoids in this tea stop the growth of cancer cells as well as prevent the growth of new ones. The antioxidants found within white tea also act as antibacterial and antiviral agents. These antioxidants strengthen your immune system, protect you against many diseases as well as free your body of free radicals. It can help destroy the bacteria that is responsible for plaque, bad breath, and tooth decay.

Nutrients

The taste and color of white tea depends on the duration the tea is steeped as well as the quality of the leaves. Generally, the color is very light tan color while the taste is described as slightly sweet and soothing. The tea contains antioxidants, polyphenols, as well as vitamin C and Carotene. The amino acid theanine is also found in white tea. This amino acid helps promote alertness and calm. Additional nutrients inside white tie include L-theanine, and caffeine. The caffeine content of white tea is around 25mg per 6 leaves. Due to the caffeine level, avoid giving it in excess to children and pregnant/breastfeeding women.

Where to Buy

White tea can be purchased in tea bags or loose leaf form. Most tea experts and aficionados maintain that loose leaf tea is the best way to create delicious tea, but Ill leave the verdict up to you. You can find this type of tea from many reputable sources including local grocery stories, and online carriers. The typical price is around $5 per 6.34 oz of the White Peony variety in tea bags. Loose leaf tea is more expensive. Silver Needle white tea and White Peony, considered the best quality, costs around $16 and up for 2 oz. This is approximately 25-30 teaspoons.

item.title: Carpet Calculator: How Much Carpet Do You Need?
item.dc:creator: editor
item.content:encoded: [caption id="attachment_1017" align="aligncenter" width="800"] Photo via Priestley + Associates[/caption] How much carpet do you need? Find out instantly with our free carpet calculator. No math skills required. [CP_CALCULATED_FIELDS id="6"] Unlike other types of flooring like hardwood or tile that can be adapted to fit any size room, carpet typically has more waste. The reason is because carpet comes in 12 or 15 wide rolls. Any leftovers rarely can be used in other rooms due to their small size. Therefore, you may need to order more carpet than you originally thought!

item.title: How Much Paint Do I Need?
item.dc:creator: editor
item.content:encoded:
Don't pick up another paint brush until you use my free paint calculator. No more running back and forth to the hardware store to get more paint halfway through - there's a better way. Learn how much paint you need to get the job done right the first time. Below you'll learn how much paint you need for:
  • Small, medium and large homes
  • Door trim, garage door trim, windows and shutters
  • Eaves and fascia
  • Doors and garage
  • Individual rooms
[CP_CALCULATED_FIELDS id="8"]

Exterior Paint Estimator

Don't want to measure the exterior walls of your house, but want a paint estimate? Here are a few guidelines to follow when painting your house: Small House: 1300 Square Feet
  • Walls: 10 Gallons
  • Trim (Includes door trim, garage door trim, windows and shutters): 1 Gallon
  • Eaves and Fascia: 4 Gallons
  • Doors and Garage: 1 Gallon
  • Total: 16 Gallons
Medium House: 2500 Square Feet
  • Walls: 15 Gallons
  • Trim (Includes door trim, garage door trim, windows and shutters): 2 Gallons
  • Eaves and Fascia: 7 Gallons
  • Doors and Garage: 2 Gallons
  • Total: 26 Gallons
Large House: 4000 Square Feet
  • Walls: 20 Gallons
  • Trim (Includes door trim, garage door trim, windows and shutters): 3 Gallons
  • Eaves and Fascia: 11 Gallons
  • Doors and Garage: 3 Gallons
  • Total: 37 Gallons

item.title: 5 Things All Craftsman Style Homes Have in Comon
item.dc:creator: editor
item.content:encoded:
A craftsman style home thats built with pride and attention to detail is a rarity today. Its no surprise that the demand for craftsman homes has been on the rise lately. In our modern era there are only a handful of custom home builders that are capable of building a high-quality craftsman style house. Fewer still are architects and designers that have the care and attention to detail to design such homes. The skill and craftsmanship that was expected from architects like Frank Lloyd Wright during the American Arts & Crafts movement in the late 19th century seems to have disappeared completely. While there are many examples of quality home construction in all areas of the country, these are usually the exception rather than the norm.

Are Craftsman Style Homes Becoming Popular Again?

Today there seems to be a new surge of energy and excitement over handmade products, art and furniture. Just look at the growth of Etsy. This may be a sign that craftsman style homes are preparing to make a reappearance in our neighborhoods again. To make sure you can identify an authentic craftsman style house over a fake, here are 5 things they all have in common:

Expose The Building Structure

One of the most iconic elements of a craftsman home is the exposed structure both inside and out. Architects from the Arts & Crafts movement were exceptional at exposing the decorative exterior wood beams and rafters. For homeowners on a budget these exposed elements should be chosen carefully. For example, consider only using high-quality woods and decorative details near the front porch and on the primary faces of the house. Some of the most beautiful craftsman houses have intricate interior details and woodwork. While it was common to have exposed wood throughout the house during the Arts & Crafts movement, budget minded homeowners today will need to be more selective. If at a crossroads between the cost of interior and exterior design elements, homeowners should focus on interior design details and craftsmanship.

Natural Materials and Handmade Design Elements

What makes craftsman homes so attractive is their use of natural building materials and handmade design elements. Special care is given to building with wood and intricate metal work. Custom home builders will need to use only quality wood and local materials. For maximum effect the exposed structure should reflect the regional building materials and natural colors. Most craftsman style houses use a mix of materials including hand-crafted stone, wood and metal work.

Incorporate the Natural Environment

The American Arts & Crafts movement was a response to the industrial materials being used during that period. One of the most important home design elements is the incorporation of the site and environment into the layout of the house. Craftsman homes are designed to incorporate the natural environment into the use and function of the house. The front porch is a primary design element and should be placed under the main extension of the roof. Craftsman homes also respond to the surrounding landscape by using low roof-lines that were influenced by prairie style architecture.

Combine Kitchen and Living Areas

Today open house plans and big living areas are common. However, the American Arts & Crafts movement was a major influence on how homes are designed today. Craftsman homes were the turning point in American architecture after the Victorian design period. Previously, families required the help of housemaids to take care of the household chores. This required the kitchen and service areas to be separated from the main living areas. Craftsman style homes on the other hand were a departure from this type of design. When help was no longer required for household chores the kitchen needed to be connected to the primary living space. The plan was opened up and no longer needed to be protected for use. In addition, during these design changes the breakfast nook became a common staple in Craftsman house plans. There was less emphasis placed on formal dining spaces and more focus on small intimate areas in the kitchen. Craftsman house plans must have a connection to dining and living rooms from the kitchen as well as access to the backyard.

Focus on Furniture

Craftsman house plans are still heavily influenced by the work of Frank Lloyd Wright. He insisted on designing the furniture and built-ins in almost every house he built. The furniture should match the design style and function of the house. Even if custom furniture is too expensive, homeowners should look for pieces that are handmade or feature intricate details.

Conclusion

The quality of Craftsman houses will vary greatly throughout the United States. The Art & Crafts movement focused heavily on the influence of the natural environment on the home design elements. For this reason no two craftsman house plans will be alike. What this means for homeowners and designers is the importance of taking into account the natural influences on the site. Architecture and home design is often strongly influenced by regional trends and building elements. The design of your craftsman style house should begin with a local tour of similar homes in the area. Its important to note the type of materials used, the orientation and even exterior decorative elements. All of these play an essential role in the design of quality craftsman house plans.

item.title: 5 Things All Modern Houses Have in Common
item.dc:creator: editor
item.content:encoded:
Open an issue of Dwell Magazine and you are sure to find stunning photos of Modern house plans. Built with an open floor plan and clean interior finishes. Wide, expansive windows to allow for an abundance of natural light and a majestic view. Not to mention the spotless interior completely devoid of all the normal household items. Look a little closer and theres a shot of a charming outdoor sitting area that seamlessly blends between the living room and backyard. It is the perfect place to have a glass of wine and watch the sunset. Life is good and everyone lives happily ever after. This is the dream of Modern home design. We all want it. Here lies the problem with Modern architecture. Most of the modern house plans featured in design magazines are located in beautiful Southern California. It is no surprise that the Modern design movement began in Los Angeles where the sun is hot and the rain practically nonexistent. In the 1940s Arts & Architecture Magazine sponsored the now famous Case Study House experiments. The intention was to showcase how new industrial materials like steel, concrete and glass could be used to build efficient homes during the post war housing boom. These homes were designed by architects like Charles and Ray Eames, Richard Neutra, Pierre Koening and many other Modern Architects. While only a handful of Case Study Houses were built their influence is still clear in Modern house plans today.

5 Ideas for Modern House Plans

Photos of modern house plans in magazines often fail to show the realities of living in a modern home in other areas of the country outside of Southern California. The fact is that if you live in anywhere between the Northeast and Northwest your lifestyle involves rain, snow, wind and cold temperatures many months out of the year. The dream of living in a Modern home with large windows and comfortable outdoor living room may seem out of reach for many. Fortunately there are many ways you can use design elements from Modern house plans in other areas of the country.

Design with the Site in Mind

One of the primary design elements of modern house plans is its relation to the site. The orientation of the house can impact natural light, ventilation, energy costs and outside views. Unfortunately most suburban homes built today are designed to minimize construction costs without consideration of the site elements. Before the design process begins you should take the time to visit the site and note important landscape elements. For instance, note how the sunlight change throughout the day and during different seasons. Check to see if the backyard will be covered with shade or exposed directly to the sunlight. Also pay attention to the sites proximity to nearby roads or highways. Use the design to protect exterior spaces from noise and maintain privacy. As you can see there are many site elements to consider when designing modern house plans. Be observant, take notes and seek the advice of an architect for additional ideas.

Place Living Spaces on the Southern Side

To take advantage of exterior views and natural light the primary living spaces must be placed on the southern side of the house. This will allow for sunlight to reach into the house during winter months and maximize energy efficiency. As the major living spaces like the kitchen, living and dining room are often the largest rooms in the house they are also the most expensive to heat. Modern house plans are carefully designed to use the sun to maintain comfortable interior temperatures throughout the year. In conjunction with energy efficient building materials, the correct layout of living spaces in modern house plans can help reduce energy costs throughout the year.

Design Outdoor Space with Weather Protection

If you enjoy spending time outside in the spring and fall but live in an area with frequent rainfall consider designing covered outdoor spaces. Even a small sitting area that is protected from the rain can create a fantastic place to relax even when the weather is less than perfect. This weather protection should be considered for the front porch or entryway while guests wait outside during the fall or winter. Keep in mind how you will enter the house from the driveway. Is there a way to design a protected path or side entry for easy access?

Use Room Adjacencies to Create an Open Plan

The open plan is an essential element of modern house plans. Creating spaces that connect with each other can turn a small house into a comfortable home. While designing your dream home try to layout the kitchen, dining and living room in a way that maximizes open space and natural light while still maintaining intimate and comfortable living spaces. Other important adjacencies are the kitchen and living room in relation to outdoor spaces. Consider the use and flow during the summer months when the doors are open and family members are spending time outdoors. Careful planning of indoor and outdoor spaces can greatly increase the available living space.

Be Creative with Storage Solutions

One of the most obvious design elements of Modern house plans is the open and minimalist interiors. Architects and Homeowners featured in design magazines seem to be the only people on Earth that can live in an empty house. The attraction of Modern architecture for many is the simple and clean lifestyle that comes with well designed spaces. For anyone that wants to achieve the simplicity the see in their favorite design magazines but still needs the necessities of daily life the secret lies in creative storage spaces. Using built in furniture or well design closets, the stuff that never seems to disappear can be quickly put away and organized. Designing successful modern homes starts with a small dose of inspiration. Begin by collecting images of your favorite modern house plans. Consider calling a local architect for ideas on how to properly use your land to maximize sun exposure and outdoor space. Even if you want to complete your home design journey alone a quick consultation with a professional may help to guide and inspire you along the way.

item.title: The Frank Lloyd Wright Guide to Home Design
item.dc:creator: editor
item.content:encoded:
[caption id="attachment_526" align="alignright" width="236"] Portrait of Frank Lloyd Wright[/caption]In the humble beginnings of my Architecture career you could find me in a dark classroom viewing slides of iconic buildings found throughout history. I loved hearing stories about the crazy conductors we call Architects. One of which was Frank Lloyd Wright. He's a prime example of the great lengths a devoted Architect will go to see his vision come to reality. I remember the story of when, during construction of Fallingwater, a house in Mill Run, Pennsylvania, engineers loudly voiced their opinion about the structural integrity of the home. The structural engineers discovered that the cantilevered overhangs were not strong enough to support the weight above. Wright insisted that they pour the concrete and continue with construction. After the concrete had set, he walked out to the edge of the surface over the creek and jumped up and down to make his case. Nothing budged. Case closed. That house continues to this day to be one of the most famous homes in America. But the bitter taste of I told you so might be making Wright turn in his grave. The sad truth is that only a few months after construction was complete it was discovered that the overhangs were in fact not designed correctly and began to sag horribly. That story about Frank Lloyd Wright has stuck with me many years later for several reasons. I think it demonstrates the commitment it takes to design and build your dream home. The unflinching vision you must maintain throughout the process. But more importantly, it leads me to the first step in designing your dream home: be stubborn.

Be Stubborn

[caption id="attachment_525" align="alignright" width="300"] Fallingwater, One of Wright's Greatest Masterpieces / Photo[/caption]On the last day of construction it will be official: this is YOUR home now. One that you will live in for many years. Maybe even the rest of your life. If we can learn anything from Frank Lloyd Wright, its the importance of being stubborn on vision. On countless occasions he found himself on the brink of financial collapse and risked his career in order to see his now famous designs come to life. In the end it worked out for him, and it will work for you too. Designing not just a home, but your dream home, requires more than just a set of plans and a stack of wood. It takes a vision and a dream. You must be committed and stubborn about seeing this vision to the end. So, whats your dream?

Look to Nature for Inspiration

[caption id="attachment_527" align="alignright" width="300"] Robie House, Classic Example of Prairie Style Architecture / Photo[/caption]The Prairie Style architecture pioneered by Frank Lloyd Wright was known for the low-pitched roof and horizontal lines that connected the house to the landscape. Even before you start designing your dream home, the initial inspiration must come from nature. The way a home connects with the landscape around it will change not only the function of the home, but also the spirit of the interior spaces. How a home is situated on the site is absolutely critical to get right from the very beginning. Not only does it affect the way spaces are used but it will cause changes in your energy and heating expenses, views, property value and available natural light. Looking to nature for inspiration begins by visiting your property and looking for clues. What natural elements are currently there? How can your house be designed to make the best use of these resources?

Create Interior Unity

[caption id="attachment_528" align="alignright" width="300"] Sitting Area inside Fallingwater / Photo[/caption]The open living spaces that are so common today were actually new design trend during time of Prairie Style Architecture. Wright believed in the power of creating Unity between spaces. His designs were a direct departure from the Victorian Style homes that came before him. These new open designs left opportunities for natural light to reach spaces deep in the center of the home. With todays modern living requirements, its more important than ever to develop unity between spaces. Make connections between the kitchen, living and dining areas to improve function and maximize space. Understand how hallways or transitions between spaces can be designed to better utilize the space and create new opportunities.

Obsess Over the Details

All of the pieces in your house must come together perfectly. Design is all about the details. Nothing else. Wright became one of the most famous Architects in America by obsessing over the details. From where the house was built, to the materials, and method of construction - it was all important to Wright. Your dream house is no exception. From the direction of your bedroom window to the finish on your kitchen cabinets, all of the details matter. Because if they dont matter to you, then its just another house - not your dream house. What details are most important to you?

Dont Forget the Furniture

Wright was interested in furniture design as much as he was Architecture. Often believing that you could not have one without the other. He gave careful consideration to how the furniture would be placed within a room and frequently designed custom built-in pieces. Furniture should not be an afterthought. It should match the architectural style and design of the home. Your furniture must reflect the detail and materials used in the overall house design. Designing your dream home requires putting many pieces of a complex architectural puzzle together carefully. As you can see there are many aspects to consider. The home design process is fun and exciting. Take your time, be stubborn and do the Wright thing.
item.excerpt:encoded: If we can learn anything about home design from Frank Lloyd Wright, its the importance of being stubborn on vision.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: If we can learn anything about home design from Frank Lloyd Wright, its the importance of being stubborn on vision.

A Review of the Wusthof 4183-7 Wusthof Classic 7-Inch Santoku Knife

With an experience of 200 years, Wusthof knifes are here to stay. We all know that Germans products are German for one reason and that is the quality. The Wusthof 7 inch Santoku knife is German made and this knife is the ideal Japanese cooks knife. The knife was designed for chopping, dicing and slicing foods in an efficient and accurate manner. When it comes to cooking, efficiency and accuracy matter the most and you cant go wrong with this type of knife. This knife is designed to prevent food from clinging and the overall flexibility of this knife is outstanding. The knife weighs in at only 8.8 ounces and it was originally released in 2001. The knife has a usable size of 7 inches and this knife is the ideal knife that you may want to use for chopping vegetables or anything of that matter. The knife is exceptionally sharp and it has a long lasting cutting edge and it can be easily sharpened after continuous use. The knife is extremely sharp and very well balanced and it can easily cut through meat, fruit, vegetables, cheese, bread and more. The knifes blade is built out of a one piece of steel that was precision-forged. The blade spline is carefully ground and polished and the edge is skillfully honed by hand. The etching bears the Wusthof name and the trident logo as well as the city of origin. The finger guard provides you with sufficient safety and comfort and it also adds heft. The rivets are also well designed as they can permanently secure the handle to the full tang. A good chefs knife should have no bevel midway across the blade and a good knife should have very thin spines. This knife is specifically designed to meet these needs and this gives it a huge advantage over other knives. A good Santoku knife should be broad and this is one of the broadest Santoku knives that I have ever used. The knife features a Japanese style blade and this is quite different from other European models. This knife has a pretty light and nimble design and this knife is great for delicate slicing and precision chopping. The knife is manufactured for professional chefs and it is designed and made in Solingen, Germany.

More Reviews

After reading a few Amazon reviews I have concluded that this knife is ideal for home cooking enthusiasts, fast_matt has said in an Amazon review that I have always wanted to try this knife and I must admit that the overall quality of this product is truly remarkable. I would definitely use this knife every day James Helms wrote in an Amazon review that I definitely love this knife and this knife has brought a lot of pleasure to my overall cooking experience. Finally, Bruce M Obrien wrote that This knife is truly outstanding, it is really light in terms of weight and it is a real pleasure to use this knife.

item.title: The Best Rain Shower Heads Revealed!
item.dc:creator: editor
item.content:encoded:
Sometimes all it takes to give a room a refreshing look and feel is a small upgrade. Take the bathroom for instance. If you want to revitalize this space, you can start by replacing your current showerhead with a product such as a rain showerhead. Rainfall showerheads come in various styles and finishes to choose from so it is easy to find one to match or enhance your existing bath dcor.
[easyazon_link asin="B004ZP97BO" locale="US" tag="neighborhoodenvy-20"][/easyazon_link] [easyazon_link asin="B0028BRQZQ" locale="US" tag="neighborhoodenvy-20"][/easyazon_link] [easyazon_link asin="B001QG6K7Y" locale="US" tag="neighborhoodenvy-20"][/easyazon_link]
[easyazon_link asin="B004ZP97BO" locale="US" tag="neighborhoodenvy-20"]Moen S6320 Velocity[/easyazon_link] [easyazon_link asin="B0028BRQZQ" locale="US" tag="neighborhoodenvy-20"]American Standard Modern Rain[/easyazon_link] [easyazon_link asin="B001QG6K7Y" locale="US" tag="neighborhoodenvy-20"]Grohe 27135000 Shower Head[/easyazon_link]
8" Round 10" Round 6.25" Round
Wall Mount Ceiling Mount Ceiling Mount
[easyazon_link asin="B004ZP97BO" locale="US" tag="neighborhoodenvy-20"]See Price[/easyazon_link] [easyazon_link asin="B0028BRQZQ" locale="US" tag="neighborhoodenvy-20"]See Price[/easyazon_link] [easyazon_link asin="B001QG6K7Y" locale="US" tag="neighborhoodenvy-20"]See Price[/easyazon_link]
Rain showerheads provide many benefits. They are relatively inexpensive and can revitalize your bathing routine to make it more enjoyable. You are able to customize water flow settings so that it feels like you are bathing under a gentle rain, or even a cascading downpour--which feels great on tired muscles. In addition, being able to regulate the water flow helps you to conserve water which can also help lower your water bill. Due to the use of universal components, showerheads are highly interchangeable and often do not require the use of any tools during the installation process. Some models of these showerheads offer water flow areas of up to eight inches or more in diameter without compromising water pressure. Using models with attractive stainless steel and glass finishes are ideal for bringing the look of an outdated shower back to life. If antique finishes fall more in line with your bathroom motif, there are also styles to fit that need and any other design theme in between. You can choose from rain showerhead models that are square, round, dome-shaped, and ones that detach from the fixture to create a handheld model. If you are really looking for that "WOW factor," you can even find styles that come with LED lights that change the color appearance of the water flow. There are a wide variety of rain showerheads on the market to choose from. Some of the most popular styles with the best reviews include the following models:

[easyazon_link asin="B00JV5HO3G" locale="US" tag="neighborhoodenvy-20"]HotelSpa Ultra-Luxury Rainfall Showerhead[/easyazon_link]

Features include an amazing 30 adjustable spray patterns in a 3-way rainfall/handheld shower combo. It comes with two adjustable showerheads that allow you to take advantage of various water flow patterns which makes you feel like you just stepped into a luxury spa. This unit is easy to install and maintain.

A-Flow Luxury Rain Showerhead

Features include an attractive 8-inch square showerhead that is made from clear acrylic glass. This unit is easy to install and can replace any existing standard showerhead. Users enjoy the large water disbursement area that provides plenty of coverage without being a drain on the water supply or the wallet.

DreamSpa Water Temperature LED Showerhead

Features include an all-chrome showerhead surface that offers five adjustable angle spray pattern choices. The LED light changes colors with water temperature variations. When it comes to finding a great rainfall showerhead, there are many options on the market that are both pleasing to the eye and to the bank account. Changing out an existing showerhead typically does not require the use of any tools and most showerhead kits come with everything you need to install the part in only a few minutes. Upgrade your existing showerhead and see what you have been missing. H2oVibe Rain Showerhead Jet with Wireless Bluetooth Speaker B00J4QTSB8

item.title: Custom Kitchen Cabinets Made Simple
item.dc:creator: editor
item.content:encoded:
Lets make sure were on the same page: almost all kitchen cabinets are custom in some way. Its just a fact. But, whether you are paying for custom built cabinetry or looking a semi-custom variety there are huge differences in price and delivery time. Not to mention the range of quality, durability and craftsmanship. Considering homeowners like you will only remodel their kitchen once or twice in a lifetime, how are you supposed to be well-versed on kitchen cabinet design trends and features? What do you need to know to make sure youre not getting ripped off by cabinet manufacturers? The good news is that we have you covered! Sign up to get our exclusive custom kitchen cabinet design advice and tips delivered straight to your inbox.

What You Need to Know About Custom Kitchen Cabinets

When deciding to look at custom kitchen cabinet options one of the main concerns is price. Since cabinets make up the bulk of the cost to design and remodel a kitchen, making a smart choice is essential. How do you get high-quality cabinets without going broke? Well, the secret lies in first determining your budget and timeline. These two items alone will greatly affect whether you can afford to purchase a custom solution or will need to look at semi-custom or stock options.

Custom Built Cabinetry

Custom built cabinetry offers an unmatched range of flexibility and options for homeowners. There is usually no limit as to what can be built. From traditional cabinet detailing to ultra modern kitchen cabinets - it's all possible! If a special request or style is needed, then a cabinetry shop will be able to create a solution. Due to the handcrafted nature of custom built cabinetry many believe that the finishes are of a lower quality than production built alternatives. That being said, custom cabinet makers have the ability to provide additional services and special requests that are unmatched in the cabinetry industry. Custom cabinetry is of course more expensive than standard options that are available off the shelf. Depending on the type of cabinets, the season and current demand, custom cabinets can take as little as 6-weeks to be completed.

Semi-Custom Built Cabinetry

Semi-custom cabinets offer the personalization of custom cabinets with the low cost advantages of production choices. Many homeowners find that using production pieces to create a custom cabinet design can save them money while meeting their design criteria. Although semi-custom cabinets offer fewer options when compared to shop built alternatives, they are a great compromise for most homeowners. Considering the fact that there are hundreds if not thousands of design combinations that can be created using semi-custom options its no wonder that they are the most popular choice.

Stock Cabinetry

Stock cabinetry is most commonly found in new home construction due to the lower price point and durable finishes. This type of cabinetry provides a short turnaround time and affordable price tag. Without the opportunity to custom design the cabinets and layout, it is not uncommon for awkward spaces and storage solutions to be found in the final product. There are many creative ways to solves these types of problems after the fact. So if budget and availability are important to you than these small sacrifices will be minor. Stock cabinetry typically provides the best bang for the buck in the short-run. Want more great custom kitchen cabinet advice? Sign up to receive our tips by email!

item.title: How to Calculate Square Footage
item.dc:creator: editor
item.content:encoded:
Learn how to calculate square footage in just seconds! Use this calculator to measure rooms, hardwood flooring, roofing, siding or even an entire house. [CP_CALCULATED_FIELDS id="9"] [easyazon_block add_to_cart="default" align="right" asin="B00002PV66" cloaking="default" layout="top" localization="default" locale="US" nofollow="default" new_window="default" tag="neighborhoodenvy-20"]To determine square feet you'll need to have two measurements ready:
  • The first is the length or depth of your space or more simply, "how long is it?"
  • Next, you'll need to determine the width of the space, or "how wide is it?"
With these measurements handy, you'll be able to calculate the square footage in seconds. Editor's Note: Planning to install new carpet? We suggest using this carpet calculator instead of the square footage calculator. Example Measurements:
  • 1 ft x 1 ft = 1 sq.ft.
  • 5 ft x 5 ft = 25 sq.ft.
  • 10 ft x 10 ft = 100 sq.ft.
  • 25 ft x 25 ft = 625 sq.ft.
  • 100 ft x 100 ft = 1000 sq.ft.

What is a Square Foot?

A "square foot" is a standard unit of measurement used frequently in remodeling, home improvement, construction and many other industries. It is defined as a square space measuring one foot on each side.

How Big is a Square Foot?

Want to know the size of a square foot? Use the conversions below to simplify your life!
  • 1 Square Foot = 144 Square Inches
  • 1 Square Foot = 0.0929 Square Meters
  • 1 Square Meter = 10.764 Square Feet
  • 1 "Square" = 100 Square Feet
  • 1 Acre = 43,560 Square Feet

item.title: Common Plumbing Problems
item.dc:creator: editor
item.content:encoded:
Plumbers are trained to handle all aspects of your residential or commercial plumbing system. When in need of a plumber the Internet offers an overwhelming amount of choices. Where does the desperate consumer turn for real advice about finding the best plumbers? Here you will find detailed guides and information on local plumbers and common plumbing problems.

Our advice on plumbers spans far and wide to deliver the best content available for the consumer. When you are looking for a local plumber there are a number of factors to consider.

Local Plumbers

Fortunately for homeowners looking to hire a local plumber there are many choices of qualified professionals. However evaluating and reviewing local plumbers can be a long and tiresome process. Depending on the severity of your plumbing problem you should consider plumbers that are licensed. Today you can see service reviews from recent customers and make an educated decision within a matter of minutes. What exactly should you look for in local plumbers?

Licensed Plumber

In the United States plumbers are required to be licensed. Regulations vary from state to state on obtaining a plumbing license, but it is an important factor when choosing a reputable plumber. They should be able to show proof of their license when they arrive at your home. Most states require a basic competency test before they issue a license to an aspiring plumber.

In addition to having a license, most plumbers will be bonded and/or insured. Take the time to ask appropriate questions about their bonding policies before they begin work. These type of insurance guarantees will protect your family and home from unexpected damage during a plumbing crisis.

Plumbing Costs

Plumbers generally charge by the hour in addition to any parts needed for the job. Most plumbers will also charge for travel time and expenses associated with the plumbing repair. Depending on the plumbing problem and the amount of work required costs can vary greatly.

When considering the right plumber for the job it’s a smart idea to get at least three separate quotes. Having multiple prices quotes available to you will help understand what is involved and the average cost. Take into account the plumbers reputation, past experience and online reviews before choosing the lowest priced quote. Like most home repairs, plumbing work is an investment. A high-quality plumber will serve you better in the long run, even though it may cost you more today.

Quick Response Time

A small plumbing headache can turn into a large plumbing emergency quickly. When looking for a local plumber near you, take into account the amount of travel time required to get to your home. Many plumbers will require an appointment to be set up before they respond on-site. The faster you can solve your plumbing crisis the better.

Although the a local plumber in your community may be able to respond the fastest, they may not be the most qualified. Weigh your options completely before agreeing to have any work performed on your house.

Emergency Plumbers

Emergency Plumbers are waiting for your call. A plumbing disaster could happen in your home or business at any time. When looking for plumbers online to handle your emergency keep in mind the quality, reputation and more importantly the location of local plumbers. The quicker the response time the better you can control a plumbing problem. In addition, if parts need to be ordered or purchased to fix the emergency you may face an increased turnaround time and overall cost.

24 hour Plumber

In the event you have a plumbing problem in the middle of the night, there are many plumbers available 24 hours a day. Most emergency plumbers charge extra to make calls during off hours. Unfortunately during an emergency, you may have no other choice than to pay the increased fees. Depending on the circumstances a plumber may be able to get the situation under control temporarily. Afterward you could consult with and get estimates from nearby plumbers to fix the problem completely.

Planning ahead and reviewing your options will save you money in the end. Remember to ask questions and use the plumbers experience with emergency situations to help you handle the problem effectively.

Plumbing Problems

Pipes break. Drains clog. Plumbing problems are inevitable at home and around the office. Today there are many qualified plumbers in your area to service your plumbing needs. When your DIY plumbing solutions fail to solve your problems its time to turn it over to a professional. Even though a licensed plumber can easily identify the cause of your problem its a good idea to diagnose the trouble spot yourself first. There are a number of factors and situations that cause serious plumbing problems but heres a list of the most common you will run into eventually.

Clogged Drain

Whether indoors or outdoors drains get clogged. The most common drains to get clogged in your home are in the kitchen and bathroom sinks. Occasionally these problems can be solved with simple products from your local grocery or hardware store. In the event the drain is clogged from a stoppage further down in the plumbing system, you will need to contact a professional plumber.

Outdoor drainage problems may be a sign of a larger plumbing failure. Many times a clogged drain in your yard can be caused by debris, mulch and other items. Typically during the fall and in longer bouts of rain drainage systems become overloaded and unable to handle the volume of water. You can take preventative measures to keep your outdoor drains clear of leaves and objects throughout the year. Evaluate where you normally have drainage problems and look for ways to minimize the amount of erosion that gets into your drainage system. Try sand bags or loose hay. Both have been effective in controlling drainage problems in many situations.

Garbage Disposal Repair

One of the most common household plumbing problems involves the garbage disposal. According to many plumbing professionals, the garbage disposal is often misused and overworked. Designed only to process food residue a standard disposal is easily clogged when larger food scraps are inserted. If you attempt to repair it yourself take precautions first. Disconnect the power to the system before cleaning out the mechanism. Use a tool or pliers to remove any objects that may be lodged in the disposal. Do not put your fingers directly into the drain to retrieve any foreign objects.

The day after Thanksgiving is one of the busiest days of the year for plumbers. They are usually called to fix a clogged or broken garbage disposal that was misused while cleaning up after a Thanksgiving meal. Dont fall victim to the Black Friday plumbing blues. Use your garbage disposal carefully and with caution.

Septic Tanks

Septic Tank problems can be costly and overwhelming. Many plumbing companies specialize in handling septic tanks only. To prevent potential problems septic tank pumping must occur regularly and consistently.

Depending on the capacity of the septic tank and the amount of people living in your household the pumping schedule may vary greatly. For instance, a large household with a small septic tank may need to be pumped every 8 months. In contrast, a small household with only 2 people using a large capacity septic tank may only need pumping every few years.

Sump Pumps

Sump pumps are frequently found in the basement of homes that experience flooding. A sump pump is designed to remove the water from the basement by pumping it into the waster water system or outside. There are various types of sump pumps available on the market ranging in styles and functions. Some common sump pump problems are caused from a lack of maintenance.

Water Heaters

Any work on your water heater must be handled by a licensed plumber. There are strict building codes around water heater installation that must be followed closely. Depending on the age, size and power source for your water heater there are many different situations that may arise. For instance, gas and electric powered water heaters must be installed with different specifications. A local plumber will be able to accurately address any problems that you have with your residential water heater.

Plumbing Services

Plumbers offer a wide range of services and specialities to solve your unique problem. From installation and improvements to repair and maintenance it can all be handled by a local plumber. Today plumbing services are performed by highly qualified and professional companies. Online resources are available to help you find the right local plumber. Reading reviews and comments from past customers can be extremely insightful. If a plumbing company does not have any testimonials available online call and ask for references.

Depending on the project at hand plumbing costs can vary greatly. In addition to labor cost, plumbers will charge for supplies, parts and travel expenses. Not to mention if plumbing work must be done after hours or under special circumstances, costs will also increase. Plumbing services are performed by experts and are paid as such. Even though you may be able to negotiate with a local plumber or find online discounts, there may not be much margin for the plumber to work with. That being said, use your best judgement when hiring a local plumber and look for quality service at affordable prices.

Residential Plumbing

Residential plumbers are able to handle the most common problems you will face in your home. Usually sinks, toilets, showers and tubs are the most frequent trouble spots. In addition, local plumbers will be able to handle more severe problems like sewers, waterlines and pipework. Many plumbing problems can begin with the kitchen sink and garbage disposal while quickly extending to problems with dishwasher drainage.

For advanced problems with water heaters and septic tanks a specialized plumber will be needed. These areas of the home are heavily regulated under local building codes. While it may be tempting to undertake a DIY project yourself, consider getting an estimate from a licensed plumber first.

Commercial Plumbing

Commercial plumbers are adept at handling large scale plumbing problems. Most office buildings have complex plumbing systems to handle the volume of water and waste on a daily basis. On such a large scale plumbing problems can escalate quickly. Access to pipes and plumbing may be more straight forward than in residential projects. Careful planning will be needed during any plumbing maintenance to avoid extended downtime and additional problems.

Get estimates from multiple plumbers before starting any repairs. Since commercial plumbing problems can potentially cause a large amount of water damage, make sure that your chosen plumber is both bonded and insured. A professional plumber may cost more today but they may save you a great deal of money by doing the job right the first time.

Recommended Plumbers

Our site is designed to offer the best advice on finding local plumbers. We also give recommendations based on customer reviews and professional associations. In addition our sponsored listings offer links to local services near you. Remember to evaluate multiple plumbers before signing any agreement to begin work. Before you know it, you will be living free of plumbing worries.

If you are still having trouble finding a qualified plumber consider consulting with a local tradesmen organization or the Better Business Bureau for additional insights. Other plumbers may be able to give an honest review of their competitors as well as their history within your community. Plumbers are not only helpful but also friendly, so dont forget to ask questions before and during the work.

item.title: The Best Steam Showers
item.dc:creator: editor
item.content:encoded:
Imagine how wonderful it would be to finish off a strenuous day at work and surround yourself with the comforting warmth of a steam room. You sigh wistfully as you picture billowy clouds of steam envelope your body and watch them float away with all the stress of the day. Anticipation grows as you get closer to home and you think about how great it is going to feel to step into the steam shower that you just added to your bathroom. You are now beginning to feel the smile spread across your face and a spring appears in your step that wasn't there before. If all this feels too good to be true, it really isn't. Many people are already enjoying the comforts of a [easyazon_link asin="B00IT3JJZC" locale="US" tag="neighborhoodenvy-20"]spa-like steam experience[/easyazon_link] in their very own homes. The basic type of enclosed shower consists of a tile room that includes a steam generator. There are many advanced models and features available with this type of bathroom accessory so it is easy to get just what you are looking for.

Complete Kits

Steam: The Secret to Living Longer?

Besides relieving stress, there are many more benefits that can be derived from using a steam shower. Unlike a traditional shower, a steam shower can help give you cleaner skin and improve blood circulation. Alternating between a one minute exposure to steam coupled with a one minute cold bath helps to remove metabolic waste from the system after working out.

Top Rated Steam Showers

There are a variety of steam showers available on the market to choose from. Some possible color and finishes include black, white, bronze, stainless steel, chrome, oil-rubbed bronze, copper, brass, and nickel, among other choices. Here are a few examples of the top-rated steam showers with the best reviews:

[easyazon_link asin="B00AG4L74S" locale="US" tag="doorways-20"]Sliding Door Steam Shower Enclosure Unit WS-703 by Eagle Bath[/easyazon_link]

[easyazon_link asin="B00AG4L74S" locale="US" tag="doorways-20"][/easyazon_link]Designed from tempered glass, this steam shower offers steam sauna with aromatherapy steam outlet, 110 - volt whirlpool massage, and a 14 jets that can give you an amazing acupuncture massage. This steam shower and tub with sliding door includes a self-cleaning generator which makes it easy to maintain. The best part about these type of kits is that all you need to do is put snap the pieces together and start enjoying it immediately. No tile installation or complicated construction required.

[easyazon_link asin="B007AMCDH4" locale="US" tag="doorways-20"]Ariel Bath ZAA212 Ameristeam Steam Shower & Sauna[/easyazon_link]

[easyazon_link asin="B007AMCDH4" locale="US" tag="doorways-20"][/easyazon_link]The Ameristeam model is a tempered glass, bow-front style steam shower and whirlpool tub combo whirlpool tub with a corner fit design that makes any bathroom magically change into a luxurious spa. This model is a complete steam shower set up that comes equipped with a steam generator and nine massage jets for full body coverage, plus six whirlpool jets which are located inside the base of the whirlpool tub. Additional amenities such as an acupuncture setting, rainfall showerhead, handheld showerhead, seating with built-in FM radio, shelves, ceiling, underwater whirlpool tub lighting, and thermostatic faucet. If you want to feel extremely pampered, this is a great way to go.

[easyazon_link asin="B00IT3JJZC" locale="US" tag="doorways-20"]Steam Shower Room with Whirlpool Tub #9001 by Constar[/easyazon_link]

[easyazon_link asin="B00IT3JJZC" locale="US" tag="doorways-20"][/easyazon_link]This steam shower enclosure and whirlpool tub combo had an elegant design that looks great in any bathroom. This particular unit comes with a steam generator, water temperature control and digital timer, FM radio and CD connector, and a hands free phone call and receiver that the user can operate through the computer control panel. The Constar steam shower is made from ABS board toughened glass and includes a whirlpool tub with five jets that are easily controlled with the computer module. Additionally it offers six body massage jets, overhead rainfall showerhead, FM radio, multi-function sliding handle shower, microphone and loudspeaker, white ceiling lamp, blue lighting, foot massage, fog free mirrors and glass, and a wealth of other features. This model has everything you need to feel like royalty.

Installation Tips

Installation of steam showers in homes are becoming more and more popular. Basic steam shower models are often are the ones with the most affordable price tags; however, there are also many other models that come with all the bells and whistles. Upgrade your bathroom with a steam shower and get the benefit of also having cleaner and healthier skin as well as improved circulation. Stepping out of your steam shower after 20 minutes and feeling even better than you did when you woke up is an experience that you want to relive again and again.

item.title: Home Appraisal Report
item.dc:creator: editor
item.content:encoded:
Attention Home Buyers: Do you know what your dream home is REALLY worth? It might be worth tens of thousands of dollars less than you think That's a good thing, right? Wrong. Let me tell you why... Now that the real estate market is booming again and prices are rising all over the country... Home buyers and sellers are running into one major problem: Low appraisals Unfortunately, if an appraisal comes in lower than expected it will kill a home sale instantly.

Your Dream Home Could Disappear Right Before Your Eyes

Let's imagine you finally found your dream home in a great neighborhood with award winning schools. Next, you offer the home seller a few thousand dollars above asking price because you have to HAVE this home and the offer is still well within your budget. Next, an appraiser will be hired to estimate the value of the property in relation to comparable homes (comps) in your area. If the appraiser returns with a value that is lower than your offer, the seller will rarely want to reduce their asking price to make this deal. After all, no one wants to see their hard-earned equity flushed down the drain especially when home prices are rising all around them. And unfortunately for you, your lender won't give you any extra money to make this deal above the appraisal value. So what will the seller do instead? They'll leave the home on the market until another buyer comes along - maybe just hours later - with an appraiser who is more easily influenced. And if you're the buyer you could lose your dream home and be left to start your home search all over again. In this article I'm going to show you what appraisers look for so you can point them in the right direction - i.e. towards your offer price. I'm not sure how long I'm going to keep this report online so read carefully and take notes.

Why Your Bank Won't Let You Spend Your Own Money

Unfortunately low appraisals are a problem many home buyers are facing in our current economy You'd think we should be able to buy and sell things at whatever price we want After all we live in a free market - God Bless the USA Using our money however we want is part of our natural freedoms, right? Unfortunately, banks don't think so. You see, a bank won't lend you money to buy a house that is worth less than the loan amount. That's because if one day you can't pay your mortgage and foreclose, the bank is going to need to reclaim ALL of their cash by selling your house. And they can't do that if they are unable to sell the house for what you bought it for. By the way, banks hate losing money. However, this wasn't a problem just a few years ago....

Did Appraisers Cause The Housing Bubble?

During the housing bubble banks were trying to underwrite mortgages as fast as they possibly could. So, they'd hire a local appraiser they trusted and tell him to come back with a favorable appraisal. If they did a good job, the appraiser was guaranteed to keep getting work for as long as they could imagine... .that is until the bubble burst. Well, as they say, hindsight is 20/20. After the bubble burst, the government took a close look at this appraisal process... ...and realized that it's not very ethical to let banks control home values. So, they put together a document called the Home Valuation Code of Conduct - aka the HVCC This code of conduct specifically stated that banks were required to hire an impartial third party to complete the appraisal from now on. These third parties are called Appraisal Management Companies (AMC) They hire the cheapest and least experienced appraisers at rock bottom prices... ...turn around and charge the bank a premium for their services... ....and then keep the difference. Typically these outsourced appraisers are unfamiliar with the neighborhoods they visit. Since these appraisers are farmed out all over the states they work in, they rarely see the same neighborhood more than once. That means they don't know the little details about your market that you know know all about. So, what happens? They pick out comparable homes - "comps" - that are of lower quality and ultimately brings down the value of the home you plan to buy.

How to Know Exactly What Your Appraiser is Thinking

To make sure your appraiser does his job right and doesn't blow the sale for you - you'll need to do some homework. You'll need to know exactly what he's looking for. That's why I created the Home Appraisal Report, a step-by-step checklist that will show you exactly what an appraiser includes in his report to the bank. This way you can fill it out ahead of time and give your appraiser a few favorable comps that he might of missed. After all, the HVCC doesn't say anything about not letting the buyer interact with the appraiser - it just says that the bank can't. If the appraiser misses the mark and you lose your dream home it's not their fault - they don't know what homes are worth in your neighborhood. The blame will be placed squarely on your shoulders. But, I don't want that to happen to you like it has for countless unprepared home buyers. After you download the Home Appraisal Report you'll be able to accurately estimate what your dream home is worth. Plus, you have direct access to the exact items your appraiser is looking for. It will be like you're reading his mind.

My 26-point Comps Table: Your Secret to Success

Inside the report you'll get a printable 26-point Comps Table that will let you easily compare homes in your neighborhood side by side. With this table you'll be able to compare the features of each home and make simple adjustments to estimate the value of your dream home. For example, if a comparable home down the street recently sold for less than your offer price .but was in poor condition and badly in need of repair you can make adjustments for this. This should increase your home value and you'll need to make adjustments for this. There are also 3 pages in the checklist dedicated to recording any improvements that have been made to the home... ...As well as a place to describe construction quality and special features such as energy efficient upgrades. You'll also discover what an appraiser looks for when evaluating your neighborhood including density and growth trends. I also include a section on how to accurately describe the site and zoning classifications - an essential but overlooked part of every appraisal. For a limited time only I'm giving my readers access to this printable report and I want you to have a copy of it, too. Normally these type of technical reports sell for $47 to $97 online... But, I know how important it is to get an accurate appraisal the first time... ...and I want every home buyer to have access to this report. So today I'm going to give you a printable copy of my Home Appraisal Report for just $17 For less than the cost of parking Downtown you can have inside access to what your home appraiser is looking for. All you need to do is click the button below to claim your copy.

You're Not Alone

As an internationally recognized designer and best-selling home remodeling author ...I've had the opportunity to work with celebrity clients in Beverly Hills and... ...Design multi-million dollar mansions in Southern California. However, I no longer work with clients individually anymore, but instead I've become an advocate for new homeowners. The fact is, homeowners today need someone they can trust while buying or building their dream home. Unfortunately, there is too much bad information out there. Not to mention, there are crooks around every corner trying to take advantage of unsuspecting home buyers. That's why it has become my mission to help as many homeowners as possible finally get the home they've always dreamed of. To make sure you know that I'm serious about helping you get the home you've always dreamed of ...I'm going to give you access to my report risk-free for 30 days. Download it, print it out and give copies to your friends. If you aren't satisfied, I will personally refund your money out of my own pocket. All you need to do is send me an email and I will take care of the rest. To get access to my Home Appraisal Report which includes...
  • Printable 26-point Comp Table
  • Improvements and Materials Checklist
  • Detailed Property Description Checklist
  • Neighborhood Evaluation Checklist
  • Site Evaluation Checklist
  • Required Exhibits Checklist
All you need to do is click the link below to get instant access to this report which normally sells for over $47... ...for just $17 I can't guarantee how long I will leave this report online at this price.

This is Your Wake Up Call

Whether you are in the middle of buying your dream home or plan to start looking in a few years... ...I don't want you to make the same mistakes I've seen countless other home buyers make. The fact is, if you leave your home appraisal in the hands of an inexperienced appraiser ...You could see your dream home disappear right before your eyes. But, the good news is that with the help of my Home Appraisal Report you can discover exactly what an appraiser is looking for. On the other hand, if you decide to continue on your own you may find yourself wondering... ...how you lost your dream home even though you made an irresistible offer. Don't settle living in your second or third choice home for the next 30 years. Instead, claim your printable copy of my Home Appraisal Report and be prepared when your appraiser shows up at your door. You can get access to the report today for just $17 Plus, your purchase is backed by my personal 30 day money back guarantee. All you need to do is click the button below to get started.
